page.title: 09FARMHOUSES IN A_J_M
page.content: {Brayne Hall}is the oldest in the area dating back to 1248;it has been much added to and altered.There is a grade 2 listed building,{Wades Green Hall}a black and white half timbered house, built in the 16th centuary.{Hoolgrave {Manor}dates back to the same time but is red brick{Red Hall}is part Georgian and Victorian but a former house is now a barn.In between the old and the new is a moat, perhaps the site of a former house{Eardswick Hall}also has a moat where a clay and wattle house once stood.The outbuildings are half_ timbered in black and white.The house has the small hexagonal window panes typical of many estate houses in South Cheshire.
